page.title: 19Morwenstow Elizabethan Fayre
page.content: On 13th July, an{Elizabethan Fayre}and banquet were held at{Stanbury Manor}in celebration of the{400th anniversary } of the restoration of the manor, and the marriage between{John Manning of {Stanbury}and{Christian Kempthorne of {Tonacombe,}in{1585. } At the fayre, were displays of longbow archery, falconry and various crafts; also an exhibition by Mrs V. Chesher of copies of the 16th Century tax lists and muster rolls. A herbalist and palmist attended. Children danced around a Maypole, in period dress, music, singing and dancing were featured at both events. Commemorative mugs were sold and the house was opened. At the banquet, Prof E.W.F. Tomlin spoke about Manning and his times. A commemorative tree will be planted and a seat provided in the parish.
